post.author: Brendan(김성욱)
post.content:
Today's topic is not for you, but for me.
Based on the OOC(Object Oriented Concept), I'd like to ask myself some questions like...
1. What kinds of 'classes' do I have?
2. What and how many methods do I have or have implemented?
At the first question, the 'Class' I meant is like the situation I can meet while I'm living. For example, 'When I meet a stranger who is not friendly and is even hostile to me' is a class. To deal with this object, I have to prepare or have implemented the 'Methods' at question 2.
As one example for the method, there could be 'I say good words to the person'. The definition is like...
private static String praise (Person stranger) { ... }
Now, you will be able to understand what I want to talk about. As a matter of fact, I, a middle-thiry aged person, have not tried to build up many Classes and Methods of each so far. There are also many 'Interfaces' which I just put off to implement to use in the real world. Actually there was no motive to struggle to do that, but I want to start this project of my own because I became stimulated by you. I appreciate those who can be my paragon.
post.title: Bad habit(2)
